verses.verse: (Complacent Self-Indulgence Will Be Punished) (Ex 19.5; Isa 32.9-11; Am 3.2; Lk 6.24) Woe to those who are at ease in Zion and for those who feel secure on Mount Samaria, the notables of the first of the nations, to whom the house of Israel resorts!

(2 Kings 18.34; 2 Chr 26.6; Isa 10.9; Jer 2.10; Nah 3.8) Cross over to Calneh and see; from there go to Hamath the great; then go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are you better (Or Are they better) than these kingdoms? Or is your (Heb their) territory greater than their (Heb your) territory,
(Isa 56.12; Am 9.10) you who put far away the evil day and bring near a reign of violence?
(Ezek 34.2, 3; Am 3.12, 15) Woe to those who lie on beds of ivory and lounge on their couches and eat lambs from the flock and calves from the stall,
(1 Chr 23.5; Isa 5.12; Am 5.23) who sing idle songs to the sound of the harp and like David improvise on instruments of music,
(Gen 37.25; Ezek 9.4; Am 2.8; 4.1) who drink wine from bowls and anoint themselves with the finest oils but are not grieved over the ruin of Joseph!
(Dan 5.4-6, 30; Am 7.11, 17) Therefore they shall now be the first to go into exile, and the revelry of the loungers shall pass away.

(Deut 32.19; Ps 106.40; Jer 51.14; Heb 6.13) The Lord GOD has sworn by himself (says the LORD, the God of hosts): I abhor the pride of Jacob and hate his strongholds, and I will deliver up the city and all that is in it.
If ten people remain in one house, they shall die.

And if a relative, one who burns it, (Meaning of Heb uncertain) takes up the body to bring it out of the house and says to someone in the innermost parts of the house, “Is anyone else with you?” the answer will come, “No.” Then the relative (Heb he) shall say, “Hush! We must not mention the name of the LORD.”
(Isa 55.11; Am 3.15) For the LORD commands, and he will shatter the great house to bits and the little house to pieces.

(Isa 59.13, 14; Am 5.7) Do horses run on rocky crags? Does one plow the sea with oxen? (Or Does one plow them with oxen) But you have turned justice into poison and the fruit of righteousness into wormwood,
you who rejoice in Lo-debar, (Or in a thing of nothingness) who say, “Have we not by our own strength taken Karnaim (Or horns) for ourselves?”

(Num 34.8; 1 Kings 8.65; Jer 5.15; Am 3.11) Indeed, I am raising up against you a nation, O house of Israel, says the LORD, the God of hosts, and they shall oppress you from Lebo-hamath to the Wadi Arabah.
